title: MD
biography: Denton Arthur Cooley (1920â€“2016) was an American heart surgeon who performed more open-heart operations than any other surgeon in history. In 1969, he implanted the first total artificial heart in a human patient at St. Luke's Episcopal Hospital in Houston. He founded the Texas Heart Institute in 1962, transforming it into the world's largest center for cardiovascular surgery and research. A graduate of Johns Hopkins School of Medicine, Cooley trained under Alfred Blalock and assisted in the first 'Blue Baby' operation in 1944. Over his 60-year career, he performed approximately 120,000 open-heart surgeries and pioneered techniques for aortic dissection repair.
techniquesInvented: Cooley Technique for Aortic Dissection Repair

awards.name: National Medal of Technology and Innovation

timeline.title: Graduated Johns Hopkins School of Medicine
timeline.description: Assisted Dr. Alfred Blalock in the first 'Blue Baby' operation that same year.

timeline.title: Founded Texas Heart Institute
timeline.description: Established what would become the largest cardiovascular center in the world.

timeline.title: First Successful US Heart Transplant
timeline.description: Performed the first successful heart transplant in the United States.

timeline.title: First Total Artificial Heart Implant
timeline.description: Implanted the first total artificial heart in a human patient, making surgical history.

timeline.title: Passed Away
timeline.description: Legacy endures through 120,000+ surgeries and the Texas Heart Institute.
